alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 8:12PM CST until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Trempealeau River at Dodge affecting Trempealeau and Buffalo Counties. For the Trempealeau River...including Dodge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Trempealeau River at Dodge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Agricultural and marsh land is flooded. At 9.5 feet, The entrance road to the Trempealeau National Wildlife Refuge is flooded. At 11.0 feet, The railroad bridge about three quarters of a mile upstream from the gage can restrict the flow. At 11.5 feet, Water covers part of County Road J in Dodge. At 12.0 feet, Low lying roads around Dodge may flood, including County Road P, as well as along a low spot on County Road J south of Dodge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 10.8 feet. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 815 AM CST.
